_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. has purchased this facility from SEK Grain, Inc.   Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. -  Independence is an Ag Retail facility that provides inputs for crop production for the local farmers. Anhydrous ammonia is one of those inputs that is important as a nitrogen fertilizer.  The following plan is how Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Independence plans to prevent accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.



1.The facility policy for accidental release prevention:                                                                    

a.This facility handles anhydrous ammonia, which is considered hazardous by EPA.  Anhydrous ammonia is a valuable tool used in production agriculture as a cost effective fertilizer.  The management of Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Independence is committed to the safe handling and prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared o work with the local fire department and other authorities to mitigate any releases and minimize the impact of the release to the community and the environment.  

                                                                    

2.Facility Information:                                                                                                                              a.The primary activity at this facility is the storage and blending of fertilizers for retail sales to area farmers.  Anhydrous Ammonia is received stored and distributed for direct application to area fields as fertilizer.  The maximum stored quantity of the storage tank would be 53,000 lbs. in our 12,000 gallon storage tank.                                                                                                                                              

3.The Worst Case Release Scenario:                                                                                                         a.The Worst Case scenario would be the release of the

entire storage tank in a gas release over 10 minutes.  The amount released would be 53,000 lbs. and would result in an end point of 1.63 miles and would effect a population of 448.  The fertilizer Institute's Degadis model was used for the end point calculations.                                                                                                                                              

4.The Alternate Release Scenario:                                                                                                          

a.The alternate release scenario would be a pipe release over 2 minutes.  The total released would be 11.908 lbs. and would result in an endpoint of 0.83 miles and would effect a population of 116.  The Fertilizer Institute's Degadis model was used for the end point calculations. 

                                

5.Accident Release Prevention Program:                                                                                                 a.The facility has complied with the Kansas Department of Agriculture's Ammonia regulations and are inspected every year.  The plant has also done its best to comply with ANSI K-61 published by the American National Standards Institute and the standards of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's Ammonia regulation,29 CFR 1910.111.  The company also has developed a RMP Prevention Program that helps us reduce accidents by proper procedures, training, maintenance, hazard reviews, compliance audits, and safety information. 

                                                                                   

6.The 5-year Accident History:                                                                                                                     

a.There has not been a reportable accident in the past 5 years. 

                                                            

7.Planned changes to improve safety:

a.Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Independence plans to update our facility to meet current and future state and federal standards for anhydrous ammonia.  As these rules are adopted or charged, Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Independence will work to address the changes in a timely manner.
